e4: Maintaining the current policy risks legal and reputational damage down the line. While investors may be accustomed to the inflated earnings, transitioning to unbiased reporting demonstrates ethical conduct and builds trust in the long run. Addressing potential market concerns through transparent communication is crucial.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy above all else. It publicly discloses all relevant information, avoiding manipulation or misleading language, even if it might impact investor sentiment in the short term. Long-term trust and accountability are built upon this foundation, fostering a healthy market ecosystem.
e6: Yes. I would ask about their plan to communicate the policy change to investors, address potential market concerns transparently, and outline safeguards to prevent future biased reporting practices.
